subject: Art
title: Web Fonts & Performance
description: Delivering custom typography on the web without killing load times.

hook.text: Early web: two fonts â€” Times and Arial. Today: thousands of web fonts from Google Fonts, Adobe Fonts, and type foundries. Beautiful typography everywhere â€” but each font file costs load time.

buildup.text: Web font formats: WOFF2 (modern, compressed â€” use this), WOFF (older fallback). Loading strategies: font-display: swap (show fallback first, swap when loaded), preload (prioritize font loading), self-hosting vs CDN.

discovery.text: Each font weight/style is a separate file. Regular + Bold + Italic + Bold Italic = 4 files. Limit to 2-3 weights maximum. A common mistake: loading 8 weights and using only 2.

twist.text: Variable fonts change the game: one file contains ALL weights as a continuous range (Thin through Black). Instead of 8 files, one compact file gives you infinite weight options. The future of web typography.

climax.text: Audit a website's fonts: open DevTools â†’ Network â†’ filter by Font. Count the files. Each one is a render-blocking request. The fastest sites use 1-2 font files. The slowest load dozens.

punchline.text: The best web font is the one the user never waits for. Performance IS design.

quiz.question: What advantage do variable fonts offer for web performance?
options: One file contains all weights, replacing multiple files with a single compact download
